nodes.text: Dessin's Dagger was a modified YT-1300 light freighter that was active during the Clone Wars. In about 21 BBY, the freighter traveled to the Druckenwell system and there, the vessel's crew attempted to fit a device to a luxury liner. However, the freight was detected by local Galactic Republic forces and a trio of Republic Z-95 Headhunters were sent to apprehend Dessin's Dagger. The freighter sped off in an attempt to flee the system, and the Z-95s followed it in hot pursuit. However, the Heroes of Cularin—a group of freelance agents from the Cularin system—exited hyperspace in the Druckenwell system in a freighter, and their ship almost collided with the Dagger. The three fighters approached the YT-1300 and in desperation, Dessin's Dagger opened fire on them and destroyed one of the Z-95s.
The Heroes of Cularin decided to assist the two remaining Z-95s, and they helped the Republic forces to disable the Dessin's Dagger and capture the freighter's crew.
Dessin's Dagger was created by Lee Pickler and Morrie Mullins, and it appeared in Outward Bound, a 2002 role-playing adventure that formed part of the Looking In trilogy of the Living Force campaign.
